newsitem.title: ITALY: Olivetti PC chief sees return to pft soon - paper.
newsitem.headline: Olivetti PC chief sees return to pft soon - paper.

text.p: Loss-making Olivetti Personal Computers, which was sold by Italian information technology group Olivetti earlier this year, can return to profitability quickly, its chief executive was quoted as saying.

OPC chief executive Bernard Auer, quoted in a report in the Financial Times on Tuesday, said: "Nobody can imagine investors would accept a business plan which does not show profitability within 12 months."

Auer said OPC planned to focus on a higher margin professional market for corporate servers and portable notebook PCs, with emphasis on a newly launched NetStrada range of corporate servers and Echos and Echos Pro notebook PCs.
"On the product side we will continue to concentrate on the professional market," he was quoted as saying.
The report said OPC also intended to reduce its reliance on Olivetti's systems and services business, which accounts for around three-quarters of its server sales.

Olivetti signed the final contract for the 250-300 billion lire sale of OPC to Piedmont International at the start of March. Piedmont is a consortium brought together by U.S. lawyer Edward Gottesmann.
